item.title: COVID-19, India, Live Update
item.description: COVID-19 affects different people in different ways. Most infected people will develop mild to moderate illness and recover without hospitalization. Most common symptoms: fever dry cough tiredness Less common symptoms: aches and pains sore throat diarrhoea conjunctivitis headache loss of taste or smell a rash on skin, or discolouration of fingers or toes For informational purposes only.

item.title: How To Approach A Machine Learning Model
item.description: How To Approach A Machine Learning Model This is just a short one , about how we are going to proceed in future posts. In this post we will be looking how we can proceed any machine learning model, form our previous post we can select a model appropriate to data we have. Once the model is selected, we should approch the model in following way. From the above image we can see the step by step we will be following in the upcoming posts, we will be expaining all the steps in details in Python.

item.title: Machine Learning Model Selection - Cheat Sheet
item.description: Model Selection. But the time consumed for creating for all these models can cause real problems, in order to solve these thing and more or less to find a well suitable model. SKlean has a cheet sheet that saves a lot time in selecting a model. from the below diagram you can see the various constaints for selection a model on basic of dataset. This is a series of post where we will be trying various machine leaernig models, first on the next we will be learning how to approach a machine learning a problem.

item.title: Travel Checklist
item.description: Why one should travel ? “It is better to travel well than to arrive.” “A mind that is stretched by a new experience can never go back to its old dimensions.” “Travel makes one modest, you see what a tiny place you occupy in the world.” “Never get so busy making a living that you forget to make a life.”

item.title: Crime Against Womens in India
item.description: Cases Against Womens In India Key Findings 4 Rape cases were filed per hour in India 13 “Cruelty by Husband or his Relatives” cases filed per hour in India Average Number of crimes Against women per year is : 194586 41% cases are classified under “Cruelty by Husband or his Relatives” In this discriptive analysis we will be looking into CRime Against Womens that are filed dataset from data.

item.title: Regression Project, Part - 4, Variable Selection Methord.
item.description: In This Project we will using variable selection methord to find the best combination of variables for a product. Drawback of this variable selection is it doesnot do will with variables with more than two categorical variables. In this post we will bec using the mtcars dataset. There are three types of Variable Selection Methord. 1. Best Subset Methord 2. Forward Stepwise Methord 3. Backward Stepwise Methord We will be comparing Adjusted R Square values of all the above models with linear regression model.

item.title: Regression Project, Part - 5, Ridge, Lasso and Elastic Net Regression
item.description: Shrinkage Methods in Linear Regression The need for shrinkage method arises due to the issues of underfitting or overfitting the data. When we want to minimize the mean error (Mean Squared Error(MSE) in case of Linear Regression), we need to optimize the bias-variance trade-off. What is this bias-variance trade-off? The bias-variance trade-off indicates the level of underfitting or overfitting of the data with respect to the Linear Regression model applied to it.

item.title: Classification, Part - 2, Multinominal logistic Regression.
item.description: This will eb small Post, we will be discusing about Multinominal Logistic Regression, When the predicted i.e when dependent variable has multiple category. We will be using the famous iris dataset The dataset consist of columns: ## [1] "Sepal.Length" "Sepal.Width" "Petal.Length" "Petal.Width" "Species" ## 'data.frame': 150 obs. of 5 variables: ## $ Sepal.Length: num 5.1 4.9 4.7 4.6 5 5.4 4.6 5 4.4 4.9 ... ## $ Sepal.Width : num 3.

item.title: Classification, Part -1 , Logistic Regression
item.description: Classification Models In classification methord, dependant variable will be a categorical variable. In this post we will be looking at one of the methord used for classification,Logistic Regression. Logistic Regression works well when the prediction varibale has two categories, we will be working with Multinomial Classification in future posts. The Dataset that we are going to use is obtained from Kaggle The Columns in our dataset are ## [1] "male" "age" "education" "currentSmoker" ## [5] "cigsPerDay" "BPMeds" "prevalentStroke" "prevalentHyp" ## [9] "diabetes" "totChol" "sysBP" "diaBP" ## [13] "BMI" "heartRate" "glucose" "TenYearCHD" As we did in other regression models, we need to prepare the data for out model construction.

item.title: Regression Project, Part -3, Multiple Linear Regression
item.description: Multiple Linear Regression. Multiple linear regression is similar to simple linear regression, in this we will be using multiple independent variable to preict the dependent variable. We will be also finding the relation between all those indipendent variable and dependent variable. The total number of variables we have : ## [1] "bedrooms" "bathrooms" "sqft_living" "sqft_lot" ## [5] "floors" "waterfront" "view" "condition" ## [9] "grade" "sqft_above" "sqft_basement" "yr_built" ## [13] "yr_renovated" "zipcode" "sqft_living15" "sqft_lot15" ## [17] "priceinK" "PYears" "Pmonth" ## Train dataset consist of 17062 entries ## Test dataset consist of 4550 entries In this PriceinK is the dependent variable all the other variables are considered as independent variables.

item.title: Regression Project, Part -2, Simple Linear Regression
item.description: So now we have a clean data, will be creating a simple model, a simple linear model. A simpole linear model gives the relationship between a indipendent variable and a dependant variable. in what way a indipendent variable affect the dedpendent variable. Now our dataset consist of the following columns. ## [1] "bedrooms" "bathrooms" "sqft_living" "sqft_lot" ## [5] "floors" "waterfront" "view" "condition" ## [9] "grade" "sqft_above" "sqft_basement" "yr_built" ## [13] "yr_renovated" "zipcode" "sqft_living15" "sqft_lot15" ## [17] "priceinK" "PYears" "Pmonth" The structure of our dataset is

item.title: Regression Project, Part -1, Data Preprocessing
item.description: Main Idea The idea of this new series of data is to understand more obout different types of regressiion and how they works. Regression, is to find a relationship between dependant variable and independent variable what kind of relationship exists. How Much each Indipendent variblee affect the dependent variable The few Regressions that we are going to work in this series are givven below Simple Linear Regression Multiple Linear Regression Logistic Regression Ridge Regression ElasticNet Regression We will be using House Sales in King County, USA dataset from Kaagle for all regression models except Logistic regression(it is a Classification Model).

item.title: Netflix Movie and TV Show Data Analysis
item.description: Important Findings: It will take 283 days from now to watch all available Movies in Netflix 4 in 10, Movies or TV Shows are not suitable for childrens under 17 67% of TV Shows never made to Second Season. Only 6% TV Shows have more than 5 Seasons Netflix and Chill, That famous saying, So netflix has entertaining us for almost a decade now.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: GitHub Documents This is an R Markdown format used for publishing markdown documents to GitHub. When you click the Knit button all R code chunks are run and a markdown file (.md) suitable for publishing to GitHub is generated. Including Code You can include R code in the document as follows: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.
